baseline: Judges recorded the concurrent undesirable social responses of: (a) verbal abuse and (b) aggression, withdrawal, and inattention.
high_intensity: Judges recorded the concurrent undesirable social responses of: (a) severe verbal abuse and (b) aggression, withdrawal, and inattention.
low_intensity: Judges recorded the concurrent undesirable social responses of: (a) mild verbal abuse and (b) aggression, withdrawal, and inattention.

baseline: Ten percent were judged to be functioning very well and 2 appeared to be doing poorly, i.e., abuse of alcohol particularly.
high_intensity: Ten percent were judged to be functioning very well and 2 appeared to be doing extremely poorly, i.e., severe abuse of alcohol particularly.
low_intensity: Ten percent were judged to be functioning very well and 2 appeared to be doing somewhat poorly, i.e., mild abuse of alcohol particularly.

baseline: This clinical study illustrates the use of contingency contracting in the treatment of drug abuse.
high_intensity: This clinical study illustrates the use of contingency contracting in the treatment of severe drug abuse.
low_intensity: This clinical study illustrates the use of contingency contracting in the treatment of mild drug abuse.

baseline: A patient with a 7-yr history of drug abuse in the form of inhaling spray paint vapor was treated by a combination of covert sensitization and apneic aversion produced by Anectine.
high_intensity: A patient with a 7-yr history of severe drug abuse in the form of inhaling spray paint vapor was treated by a combination of covert sensitization and apneic aversion produced by Anectine.
low_intensity: A patient with a 7-yr history of mild drug abuse in the form of inhaling spray paint vapor was treated by a combination of covert sensitization and apneic aversion produced by Anectine.

baseline: Compared to the flow parameters in a control group (17 patients without alcohol abuse and diseases of the central nervous system) CBF was decreased significantly in the alcoholics, and this decrease was dependent from the severity of the clinical syndrome and of the mental disfunction.
high_intensity: Compared to the flow parameters in a control group (17 patients without severe alcohol abuse and diseases of the central nervous system) CBF was decreased significantly in the alcoholics, and this decrease was dependent on the extreme severity of the clinical syndrome and of the mental dysfunction.
low_intensity: Compared to the flow parameters in a control group (17 patients without minor alcohol abuse and diseases of the central nervous system) CBF was decreased somewhat in the alcoholics, and this decrease was dependent on the mild severity of the clinical syndrome and of the mental dysfunction.

baseline: The findings in both groups seem to suggest that the incidence of the suicidal attempts has almost doubled in the last decade; there was a 20-percent decrease in alcohol abuse, and a 25-percent increase in drugs abuse within the last 10 years; it would appear that, with the exception of the psychotic and psychopathic patients, in both groups of patients their suicidal behaviour was goal- and gain-directed, and aimed at changing the environment to the patient's benefit.
high_intensity: The findings in both groups seem to suggest that the incidence of the suicidal attempts has almost doubled in the last decade; there was a 20-percent decrease in severe alcohol abuse, and a 25-percent increase in alarming drugs abuse within the last 10 years; it would appear that, with the exception of the psychotic and psychopathic patients, in both groups of patients their suicidal behaviour was goal- and gain-directed, and aimed at changing the environment to the patient's benefit.
low_intensity: The findings in both groups seem to suggest that the incidence of the suicidal attempts has almost doubled in the last decade; there was a 20-percent decrease in minor alcohol abuse, and a 25-percent increase in mild drugs abuse within the last 10 years; it would appear that, with the exception of the psychotic and psychopathic patients, in both groups of patients their suicidal behaviour was goal- and gain-directed, and aimed at changing the environment to the patient's benefit.

baseline: This measure coincided with the midpoint of a four-year survey into drug abuse which was being carried out in that area.
high_intensity: This measure coincided with the midpoint of a four-year survey into severe drug abuse which was being carried out in that area.
low_intensity: This measure coincided with the midpoint of a four-year survey into mild drug abuse which was being carried out in that area.

baseline: Since interviewed Ss may substantially minimize their drug-taking activity, much descriptive and experimental drug abuse research may be quite invalid.
high_intensity: Since interviewed Ss may substantially minimize their drug-taking activity, much descriptive and experimental severe drug abuse research may be quite invalid.
low_intensity: Since interviewed Ss may substantially minimize their drug-taking activity, much descriptive and experimental mild drug abuse research may be quite invalid.

baseline: A sample of 153 men with alcohol abuse drawn from a population census study was divided in one group of men whose abuse was officially registered (0-group) and another where the abuse was known from other sources (A-group).
high_intensity: A sample of 153 men with severe alcohol abuse drawn from a population census study was divided in one group of men whose abuse was officially registered (0-group) and another where the abuse was widely known from other sources (A-group).
low_intensity: A sample of 153 men with minor alcohol abuse drawn from a population census study was divided in one group of men whose abuse was officially registered (0-group) and another where the abuse was known from other sources (A-group).

baseline: The data indicate that response-contingent shock is effective in suppressing lever-pressing for both abuse agents.
high_intensity: The data indicate that severe response-contingent shock is effective in forcefully suppressing lever-pressing for both abuse agents.
low_intensity: The data indicate that mild response-contingent shock is somewhat effective in suppressing lever-pressing for both abuse agents.
